snippet: A lack of visitors and money threatens to turn the Great Platte River Road Archway in Nebraska into a symbolic and literal blight in the vast expanse of the Midwest.
abstract: Lack of visitors and funding threatens to turn Great Platte River Road Archway in Nebraska into symbolic and literal blight in the vast expanse of the Midwest; advocates say monument depicts history of push west, but attendance has fallen steadily since its opening in 2000 and historic attraction is near bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: A lack of visitors and money threatens to turn the Great Platte River Road Archway in Nebraska into a symbolic and literal blight in the vast expanse of the Midwest.

headline.main: A Monument to the West That Many Pass By
headline.print_headline: A Monument to the West That Many Pass By
